subject: Re: Writing a text in TestRunner
msgSnippet: Since we are talking about logging here let me add something more. If you want to see something more than just dots ..........F.....F.... like behaviour - if
messageBody:
Since we are talking about logging here let me add something more. If
you want to see something more than just dots ..........F.....F....
like behaviour - if that is what your question is - I would recommend
to extend the TestRunner class and use it. Serach through this class
to see which method you would like to override to get the output the
way you want. I dont want to give a complete solution and you may use
your own judgement to decide what is best suited for you.

- Nilesh

--- In junit@y..., Eric Vought <evought@q...> wrote:
> You can also add logging to your code. We have a testcase which
> automatically collects and organizes the log output from the
> class-under-test. You can just tail the log file or add some
> code to the GUI testrunner to display it. Apache/Jakarta has a nice
> logging system. We also have our own package
(http://qcijutils.qlue.com)
> whcih includes a LoggerTestCase base class. If you use our package,
> check out the latest source. LoggerTestCase is not in the last
binary jar.
>
> On Mon, 15 Oct 2001, Chris Eppstein wrote:
>
> > We send this kind of info to stdout on my project. A better
abstraction
> > would be very nice so that which ever runner is used it could be
displayed
> > as appropriate in that environment.... I know that JsUnit
provides this with
> > a debug() method but I haven't seen anything like this for JUnit.
> >
> > Chris
